newsitem.title: USA: Autodesk gets damages reduced to $7.8 mln.
newsitem.headline: Autodesk gets damages reduced to $7.8 mln.

text.p: Autodesk Inc said Monday that the U.S. District Court for the District of Vermont has reduced the damages payable by Autodesk in a 1994 trade secret case to $7.8 million plus interest from $25.5 million.
Autodesk had appealed after the original ruling in favor of Vermont Microsystems Inc in December 1994.
Autodesk took a one time charge of $25.5 million in the fourth quarter of fiscal year 1995, and has been accruing interest of about $500,000 per quarter since the original judgment.
Autodesk said in a statement the latest judgment reflects reasonable royalties from products using the Vermont Microsystems technology.
